page.title: 19SAMPFORDS LIGHT INDUSTRY
page.content: In this rectangle there is a small factory. It is situated on the road B1055 to Hempstead. This factory makes wood chippings to be used for horse riding training in many surrounding stables. The men who cut down the trees bring the trunks to this factory. There the bark is stripped off and cut into chippings. Some of the chippings are large and some are small. Several men work at this factory. The chippings are then delivered to the stables. Sometimes the chippings are used for bedding the horses and other animals. Mainly they are used in the manage for training purposes. Sarah Greene at the local riding stable uses these chippngs.
